title: Drawing, "Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Chicago International Exposition: Living Room Plan", 1933
medium: Graphite and black ink on white wove paper, double ruled border in graphite
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink at lower right: Central Station Industry Exhibit/Layout of Living Room/Scale 3/4"=1',0" Feb. 28, 1933/C.G. Beersman-Arch. Inscribed in black ink with dimensions, instructions, materials throughout; Inscribed in graphite with dimensions, materials, instructions throughout
description: Floorplan for living room, Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Chicago International Exposition. Plan shows various materials, including carpeted floor. Room to be equipped with electrical heating and air conditioning. Drawing shows notations for electrically operated Venetian blinds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Chicago International Exposition: Living Room Plan", 1933.
1933. Graphite and black ink on white wove paper, double ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-283.
